terms.term: AVX (Advanced Vector Extensions): A set of CPU instructions designed to accelerate performance for tasks like multimedia processing, scientific computations, and data analytics by enabling parallel processing with 256-bit vector operations.

AVX2: An enhanced version of AVX that expands the capabilities to support integer-based operations and additional vector processing instructions, improving performance for a broader range of workloads.

AVX-512: A further extension of AVX offering 512-bit vector operations, delivering significant performance boosts for highly parallel workloads, such as cryptography, machine learning, and data-intensive tasks, but with higher power consumption.
